intro: Erigeron divergens var. cinereus, commonly known as gray fleabane, is a perennial herb native to North America. It features a hairy, branching stem that often grows up to 30 inches tall. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming from late summer to early fall. Its leaves are narrow, grayish-green, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils.
